law.catch_line: Interim state employees designated as craftspersons -- Permission to sell.

text.section: Notwithstanding KRS 11A.020, 11A.040, and 45A.340, or any other law to the contrary, the commissioner may designate as a craftsperson any interim state employee whose duties consist primarily of craft-making demonstrations and who has been juried by a craft jury.

Persons designated as craftspersons under subsection (1) of this section may sell craft products to gift shops operated by the Department of Parks, provided that the products are made from materials that have not been purchased with state funds.

law.history: Created 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 68, sec. 3, effective July 12, 2006.
